issues.description: The problem statement’s Stock class specifies a method emptyStock(), but the template Stock class instead defines clearInventory(). Students will look for emptyStock() and won’t find it in the template, causing confusion.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the template method clearInventory() to emptyStock() (or add an emptyStock() wrapper) so the template matches the problem’s specification.

issues.description: The Stock class defines its clearing method as clearInventory() in the template, but the problem statement and solution expect a method named emptyStock(). This naming mismatch will confuse students when implementing or invoking the required method.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the template’s clearInventory() method to emptyStock() so it aligns with the problem statement and the solution implementation.
